document.discussion_title: Beyonce's "Lemonade" comes to iTunes after 24-hour exclusivity window on Tidal - CBS News
document.topic_text: Beyonce shows business savvy in "Lemonade" rollout Given the veil of secrecy that usually surrounds releases by both Beyonce and Tidal, it is unclear if this was always the plan or if it was a move to mollify fans who complained online about the exclusivity. The hashtag #BuyLemonadeoniTunes quickly took over Twitter Monday morning. Kanye West, Tidal hit with class action lawsuit over "The Life of Pablo" release Tidal still has some hold over the hot-topic release, though, as the subscription service remains the only place to stream "Lemonade" -- a status that apparently won't be changing. So if listeners aren't interested in actually purchasing the album, they'll have to sign up for Tidal, as Spotify and Apple Music streams aren't in the cards, apparently. © 2016 CBS Interactive Inc.
